skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, artifacts, posters, or applications (examples include websites, landing pages, dashboards, React components, HTML/CSS layouts, or when styling/beautifying any web UI). Generates creative, polished code and UI design that avoids generic AI aesthetics.
skill.summary: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill wh...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with no executable code. Contains only design guidance and best practices for frontend development with no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Creates production-ready, visually striking web interfaces with bold aesthetic choices that stand out from generic AI-generated designs.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-grade HTML/CSS/JavaScript code with distinctive aesthetics
Create React, Vue, or vanilla JS components with thoughtful design choices
Design cohesive color schemes and typography systems using CSS variables
Build responsive layouts with creative spatial compositions
Apply contextual visual effects like gradients, textures, and shadows
Craft unique interfaces across various aesthetic styles (minimalist, maximalist, brutalist, retro-futuristic, etc.)
limitations: Focuses on frontend code generation only, not backend functionality
Requires clear context about purpose and audience for optimal results
Design choices are interpretive and may need refinement based on specific brand guidelines
Does not include asset generation (images, icons) beyond code-based visuals

use_cases.title: Landing Page Creation
use_cases.description: Build a distinctive landing page with bold typography, creative layouts, and engaging animations that capture visitor attention
use_cases.target_user: Marketers and founders launching new products or services

use_cases.title: Dashboard Design
use_cases.description: Create functional, aesthetically refined dashboards that balance data density with visual appeal and usability
use_cases.target_user: Product managers and developers building internal tools or SaaS applications

use_cases.title: Component Library Development
use_cases.description: Generate reusable React/Vue components with cohesive styling and thoughtful interaction patterns

use_cases.title: Portfolio or Showcase Sites
use_cases.description: Design memorable, creative interfaces that showcase work with unique aesthetic direction

use_cases.title: Web Application UI Refresh
use_cases.description: Modernize existing interfaces with fresh design choices that differentiate from generic templates
use_cases.target_user: Teams looking to rebrand or elevate their product's visual identity

prompt_templates.title: Landing Page with Specific Tone
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a landing page for [product/service] targeting [audience]. Use a [brutalist/minimalist/maximalist/retro-futuristic] aesthetic that feels [adjectives]. Key message: [value proposition]
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a landing page with a specific aesthetic direction

prompt_templates.title: React Component with Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [component type] React component for [use case]. The design should feel [tone/mood] and include [specific features]. Target users are [audience description]
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating reusable components with clear design requirements

prompt_templates.title: Dashboard Interface
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a dashboard for [purpose] showing [data types]. Users need to [key actions]. Style should be [aesthetic direction] with emphasis on [priority: readability/visual impact/density]
prompt_templates.scenario: When building data-focused interfaces that need both function and form

prompt_templates.title: Experimental UI
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an experimental interface for [purpose] that breaks conventions. Push boundaries with [specific aspect: typography/layout/motion/color]. Make it unforgettable
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want to explore creative, boundary-pushing designs

output_examples.input: Create a landing page for an AI-powered music creation tool targeting electronic music producers. Use a dark, futuristic aesthetic with vibrant accent colors
output_examples.output: Production-ready HTML/CSS/JS code featuring: custom font pairing (display + mono), dark theme with neon accent gradients, asymmetric grid layout, scroll-triggered animations for feature reveals, interactive waveform visualizations using CSS/Canvas, and atmospheric background effects with gradient meshes and grain textures

output_examples.input: Build a minimalist React component for a meditation timer. The design should feel calm and refined
output_examples.output: React component with: elegant serif typography, soft neutral color palette with CSS variables, generous spacing and centered composition, subtle fade-in animations, smooth circular progress indicator, gentle sound-wave visualization, and carefully considered micro-interactions for start/pause states

best_practices: Always start by understanding the purpose, audience, and desired tone before coding
Choose a bold aesthetic direction and execute it with consistency across all elements
Use distinctive typography - avoid generic system fonts and overused choices like Inter or Roboto
Implement cohesive color systems using CSS variables for maintainability
Focus animations on high-impact moments rather than scattered micro-interactions
Create depth and atmosphere with backgrounds, textures, and layered effects
Match implementation complexity to the aesthetic vision (elaborate code for maximalist designs, precision for minimalist)
Test across different aesthetic directions - vary between light/dark themes and different styles
Prioritize CSS-only solutions for simpler implementations, use libraries when needed for complex interactions
anti_patterns: Using generic font combinations like Inter/Roboto/Arial without considering alternatives
Defaulting to purple gradients on white backgrounds or other cliched color schemes
Creating predictable, template-like layouts without contextual adaptation
Adding animations everywhere instead of focusing on meaningful moments
Using solid color backgrounds when atmospheric effects would add depth
Converging on the same design choices (like Space Grotesk) across different projects
Implementing minimal code for a maximalist vision or vice versa
Ignoring the specific context and audience when making design decisions

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill can generate code for vanilla HTML/CSS/JavaScript, React, Vue, and other modern frontend frameworks. Specify your preferred stack in the prompt for best results.

faq.question: How do I get a specific aesthetic style?
faq.answer: Be explicit about the tone and aesthetic direction in your prompt. Use descriptive terms like 'brutalist', 'minimalist', 'retro-futuristic', 'editorial', or describe the mood you want. The more context about purpose and audience, the better.

faq.question: Will the generated code be production-ready?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill focuses on generating functional, production-grade code with proper structure, accessibility considerations, and performance in mind. However, you should still review and test the code in your specific environment.

faq.question: How can I ensure I get unique designs each time?
faq.answer: The skill is designed to avoid repetitive patterns by varying aesthetic choices. Providing different context, audiences, and tones for each project will naturally lead to diverse outputs. Request specific aesthetic directions to push creativity further.

faq.question: Can this skill create backend functionality?
faq.answer: No, this skill focuses exclusively on frontend design and implementation. It creates the visual interface and client-side interactions but does not generate server-side code or database logic.
